#Text=Mr.
#Text=Beyani: I would like to thank the Permanent\r
#Text=Mission of Argentina and the other members of the\r
#Text=Security Council for holding this open debate on\r
#Text=the critical issue of displaced women and girls in\r
#Text=the framework of the women and peace and security\r
#Text=agenda.
#Text=The intersection of peace and security, human\r
#Text=rights and development is critical to dealing with the\r
#Text=issue of internal displacement.
#Text=We must not lose sight\r
#Text=of the important role that internally displaced women\r
#Text=can play in negotiating peace, ensuring their human\r
#Text=rights and bringing about development in post-conflict\r
#Text=situations.
#Text=As part of my mandate, I enter into dialogue with\r
#Text=Governments and the international community alike to\r
#Text=advise on and advocate for the best possible protection\r
#Text=of internally displaced persons (IDPs), and in all my\r
#Text=field missions I pay specific attention to the protection\r
#Text=of internally displaced women and girls.
#Text=This year\r
#Text=alone, I have carried out missions to Kenya, Azerbaijan,\r
#Text=Cote d'Ivoire, Haiti and Ukraine.
#Text=Such field missions\r
#Text=are significant in that they provide an early warning\r
#Text=system for the international community through the\r
#Text=Human Rights Council, the General Assembly and, in\r
#Text=this instance, the Security Council itself on the actual\r
#Text=causes, conditions and situations of displacement.
#Text=My mandate receives specific support from\r
#Text=United Nations agencies and entities, in particular\r
#Text=the Office of the United Nations High Commissioner\r
#Text=for Human Rights, the Office of the United Nations\r
#Text=High Commissioner for Refugees and the Office for\r
#Text=the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs, and I am\r
#Text=grateful for their support and great collaboration.
#Text=My\r
#Text=work could not be possible without the outstanding\r
#Text=support extended by Member States, both those\r
#Text=working to cope with and to protect IDPs and those\r
#Text=supporting action to improve the lives of internally\r
#Text=displaced persons internationally.
#Text=I am grateful for\r
#Text=the ever-growing cooperation extended by States to\r
#Text=my mandate.
#Text=I would also like to highlight the Arria\r
#Text=Formula meeting in May on the protection of IDPs,\r
#Text=co-chaired by Chile and Argentina, which I had the\r
#Text=privilege to address and during which the issue of\r
#Text=internal displacement and threats to international peace\r
#Text=and security were tackled.
#Text=We started 2014 with an unprecedented peak in the\r
#Text=number of persons forcibly displaced within their own\r
#Text=countries due to armed conflict, generalized Violence\r
#Text=or human rights violations - 33.3 million internally\r
#Text=displaced persons, the highest figure ever recorded.
#Text=In many countries, IDPs are also displaced by natural\r
#Text=disasters, further compounding existing vulnerabilities.
#Text=Women and girls account for some half of the world's\r
#Text=IDP population.
#Text=Since the 1990s, greater attention has been paid to\r
#Text=the rights and needs of women and girls in emergency\r
#Text=and post-conflict situations and to promoting gender-\r
#Text=sensitive approaches in humanitarian, development\r
#Text=and early recovery response.
#Text=A wide range of\r
#Text=resolutions - for instance, the landmark resolution\r
#Text=1325 (2000) - but also policies, gender-mainstreaming\r
#Text=efforts and targeted programmes have been adopted in\r
#Text=this regard, and they have increasingly encompassed\r
#Text=internally displaced women and girls.
#Text=The 1998 Guiding Principles on Internal\r
#Text=Displacement, which detail the specific rights of\r
#Text=internally displaced women and girls, have been\r
#Text=recognized by the General Assembly and in Security\r
#Text=Council resolutions.
#Text=The Guiding Principles have\r
#Text=informed the inclusion of concrete and progressive\r
#Text=provisions on internally displaced women in subsequent\r
#Text=instruments, such as the 2006 Pact on Security,\r
#Text=Stability and Development in the Great Lakes Region\r
#Text=and the 2009 African Union Kampala Convention for\r
#Text=the Protection and Assistance of Internally Displaced\r
#Text=Persons in Africa.
#Text=In 2013, I dedicated my thematic\r
#Text=report to the Human Rights Council to the situation\r
#Text=of internally displaced women, and during this debate\r
#Text=I would like to draw to the attention of the Security\r
#Text=Council to that report.
#Text=Despite such positive developments, responses to\r
#Text=internal displacement still do not adequately address\r
#Text=the specific concerns and roles of women and girls.
#Text=During situations of conflict and violence, women and\r
#Text=girls flee to escape arbitrary killings, rape, torture,\r
#Text=inhumane or degrading treatment or starvation.
#Text=They may have been the victims of such violations\r
#Text=themselves or seen their loved ones attacked and\r
#Text=abused.
#Text=The experience of my mandate is that women\r
#Text=and girls are targeted as a means of armed conflict - to\r
#Text=destroy and humiliate communities, to manipulate the\r
#Text=demographic composition of communities, for sexual\r
#Text=slavery including enforced concubinage, and at times\r
#Text=enforced sterilization.
#Text=As IDPs, women experience the\r
#Text=various human rights challenges that are characteristic\r
#Text=to displacement situations and that often place IDPs\r
#Text=at greater risk than other affected populations.
#Text=Such\r
#Text=challenges include the loss of livelihoods and key\r
#Text=documentation, as well as the lack of effective access\r
#Text=to a number of important rights and services.
#Text=In addition, internally displaced women often\r
#Text=face double discrimination, based on being both\r
#Text=an IDP and a woman, and experience human rights\r
#Text=challenges due to the intersection of gender with other\r
#Text=factors such as age, group affiliation such as minority\r
#Text=status, disability and civil or socioeconomic situations.
#Text=Displaced women often have to assume new gender\r
#Text=roles that further expose them to gender-based violence,\r
#Text=including physical violence and trafficking.
#Text=Those\r
#Text=roles include being the only breadwinners and taking\r
#Text=on the increased burden of care for extended families.
#Text=Internally displaced women risk their lives, safety\r
#Text=and physical integrity to protect their husbands and\r
#Text=families.
#Text=They have told me, "If we let their husbands\r
#Text=and male children fetch firewood, food or water, they\r
#Text=will be killed, whereas we may be raped but spared\r
#Text=death".
#Text=Other specific protection concerns for internally\r
#Text=displaced women include inequitable access to\r
#Text=assistance and psychosocial support, education,\r
#Text=training and livelihoods; poor reproductive health care;\r
#Text=and exclusion from decision-making processes.
#Text=The\r
#Text=fact that more IDPs tend to live in urban rather than\r
#Text=camp or rural settings also raises additional challenges\r
#Text=that have detrimental impacts on women and girls.
#Text=I\r
#Text=first visited cote d'Ivoire a year after the end of the\r
#Text=post-electoral violence.
#Text=Many IDPs had found refuge in\r
#Text=urban areas, including girls who had been impregnated\r
#Text=during displacement and could not go back to their\r
#Text=communities as a result.
#Text=However, the inability of\r
#Text=IDPs to continue renting their shelters in those urban\r
#Text=centres, once the cash grant they received to enable\r
#Text=them to stay in urban areas ran out. pushed the most\r
#Text=vulnerable communities, including women and girls, to\r
#Text=the outskirts of the city.
#Text=Many displaced women and\r
#Text=girls, particularly those belonging to minorities, are at\r
#Text=risk of statelessness.
#Text=Pre-existing patterns of discrimination in many\r
#Text=of those contexts are exacerbated during conflict and\r
#Text=contribute to violations of women's rights to housing,\r
#Text=land and property.
#Text=For instance, during my visit to Sri\r
#Text=Lanka, I was struck by the fact that many IDP women\r
#Text=either lacked proper documentation to their land or had\r
#Text=documents in the name of their deceased husbands or\r
#Text=fathers, preventing them from accessing their land.
#Text=To respond to those intricate problems with far-\r
#Text=reaching consequences, we need to look at long-term\r
#Text=solutions.
#Text=Displacement is not just a humanitarian issue,\r
#Text=but also an issue ofbuilding peace, and constitutes a long-\r
#Text=term development challenge with profound political,\r
#Text=economic, environmental and security implications.
#Text=If left unaddressed, protracted displacement generates\r
#Text=further marginalization, inequality, fragility and\r
#Text=vulnerability and erodes women's resilience.
#Text=Displacement can overwhelm the institutional\r
#Text=capacities of affected States, which are already dealing\r
#Text=with major conflicts or disasters.
#Text=Many States have\r
#Text=neither policy frameworks or coordination systems in\r
#Text=place to respond to internal displacement, nor a set of\r
#Text=procedures to bring quick assistance to populations\r
#Text=made extremely vulnerable from one day to another as\r
#Text=they have lost livelihoods, social protection and have\r
#Text=gone through traumatic experiences.
#Text=States also lack\r
#Text=comprehensive IDP registration systems by age and\r
#Text=gender.
#Text=More needs to be done ifwe are to respond adequately\r
#Text=to the specific protection concerns of IDP women.
#Text=Data\r
#Text=collection disaggregated by sex, age, location and other\r
#Text=key indicators is critical for effective advocacy and the\r
#Text=development of programmes to respond to the specific\r
#Text=needs of IDP women at all stages of displacement,\r
#Text=irrespective of the cause of displacement.
#Text=National and\r
#Text=international efforts to collect, update, analyse and\r
#Text=disseminate both quantitative and qualitative data on\r
#Text=IDPs, including those outside of camps, displacement-\r
#Text=affected communities and communities at risk of\r
#Text=displacement should be strengthened.
#Text=A more preventive approach to sexual and gender-\r
#Text=based violence in the context of internal displacement\r
#Text=is also essential.
#Text=In that regard, gender-sensitive\r
#Text=training should be provided more systematically to\r
#Text=police and military forces, judiciary personnel and\r
#Text=social workers.
#Text=A stronger focus on prevention is also\r
#Text=required within the households and communities of\r
#Text=the internally displaced, including engaging men and\r
#Text=boys in those prevention and protection efforts.
#Text=States\r
#Text=should take all measures to combat impunity for sexual\r
#Text=and gender-based violence, including by investigating\r
#Text=and holding perpetrators accountable.
#Text=Efforts to reduce\r
#Text=exposure to sexual violence also entails ensuring that\r
#Text=survivors have access to appropriate support, including\r
#Text=reproductive health care and psychosocial services.
#Text=Ensuring access to justice and accountability\r
#Text=mechanisms is key when addressing internal\r
#Text=displacement with a gender lens.
#Text=In addition to\r
#Text=promoting access to criminal and civil justice systems\r
#Text=for IDP women, it is also essential to consider how their\r
#Text=concerns can be addressed through transitional justice\r
#Text=measures such as truth and reconciliation commissions\r
#Text=and reparations.
#Text=Donor accountability for gender-\r
#Text=equality programming for IDPs is essential and entails\r
#Text=more effective integration of gender issues into donor\r
#Text=practices.
#Text=I was heartened by the resilience of IDP women\r
#Text=I met in Ukraine.
#Text=Many of them were volunteering to\r
#Text=help other displaced persons.
#Text=Meaningful participation\r
#Text=by IDP women and girls in the development,\r
#Text=implementation, monitoring and evaluation of laws,\r
#Text=policies, programmes and activities that affect their\r
#Text=lives at all stages of displacement is key in the response\r
#Text=to internal displacement.
#Text=IDP women, as individuals,\r
#Text=have the right to make free and informed decisions\r
#Text=concerning the resolution of their displacement on the\r
#Text=basis of adequate and appropriately communicated\r
#Text=information, participate fully in building peace and\r
#Text=in planning and management of their return, local\r
#Text=integration or resettlement elsewhere.
#Text=The participation\r
#Text=and leadership of IDP women in finding durable\r
#Text=solutions that address their very specific concerns is\r
#Text=critical.
#Text=I would like to thank again Argentina for the\r
#Text=opportunity to address the Security Council today.
